name: Matering Basic Commands
objective: Understand and apply basic command-line commands to perform everyday tasks.

questoins: Open your terminal or command prompt in Desktop.
Use a command to display your current working directory
Create a new directory named CLI_Task.
Inside CLI_Task, create two more directories: MyDocs and Projects.
sections.hint: Use a command that begins with mk.

questoins: List all the files and directories inside CLI_Task.
Now, navigate into MyDocs without leaving the current directory or typing the full path.
While still inside MyDocs, create an empty file named my_notes.txt.
Add the line "This is my first note." to my_notes.txt.
Display the contents of my_notes.txt to confirm the addition.
Now, append another line to my_notes.txt: "CLI commands are powerful."
Display the contents of my_notes.txt again to confirm the appended content.
Move my_notes.txt from MyDocs to Projects.
Verify the move by listing the contents of both directories.
Navigate to Projects and remove my_notes.txt.
Confirm the removal by trying to list or display the contents of my_notes.txt.
Without navigating out of the Projects directory, create a file inside MyDocs named challenge.txt and add the line "I completed the challenge!".
List the contents of MyDocs from within the Projects directory without navigating to MyDocs.
